compliance_reasoning: The regulation (Section 103) requires regulated entities to permit and facilitate submission of complaints in writing by post and by electronic means. The document provided is a pension life cover scheme rules document that outlines the rules, definitions, and operations of a pension scheme. It does not contain any information about complaint submission processes or procedures. The document appears to be a product documentation rather than a complaints handling policy. There is no section in the provided excerpt that addresses how complaints can be submitted to the regulated entity.
regulation_title: Form of complaints that shall be facilitated
regulation_text: 103. A regulated entity shall permit and facilitate submission of complaints in writing by post and by electronic means.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
